meanings.definition: Give up a right or claim voluntarily.
meanings.sent1: She waived her turn to let someone else go first.
meanings.sent2: The athlete waived his prize money to support a charity.
meanings.sent3: The student waived her dessert in exchange for extra credit.
meanings.sent4: He waived his ownership of the company to avoid a conflict of interest.
meanings.sent5: The driver waived his right of way to allow the ambulance to pass.

meanings.definition: Dismiss or put aside for the time being.
meanings.sent1: The teacher waived the homework assignment due to the snow day.
meanings.sent2: The manager waived the usual rules to accommodate the special event.
meanings.sent3: The chef waived the recipe and decided to improvise with the ingredients.
meanings.sent4: She waived the meeting until everyone was available to attend.
meanings.sent5: The judge waived the usual penalty and opted for a warning instead.
